Honestly, I think most of the mega evolutions are pretty terrible, at least 
speaking design wise. One thing that bugged me about the designs was that 
the proportions of certain body parts didn't match the other proportions of 
the other body parts. I also think that some mega evolutions were a missed 
opportunity for the pokemon itself.
5. Mewtwo X. I love that they made it a psychic and fighting type, and I 
can see that it's a major reason people like this pokemon so much, but its 
design could have been much better. For instance, who made his feet so 
long? It doesn't fit the rest of his body. They should have cut some of the 
length on his feet. Also, if he's going to be a fighting type, then I need 
to look at it and go "that's a fighter," and I don't see that in this 
design. It was a missed opportunity in my opinion.
4. Manetric. The only thing that is wrong with this pokemon is the giant 
lightning bolt. It is way too big for such a small pokemon. Poor thing. 
That bolt covers his whole body, and it looks like it's heavy to move. 
Also, Manetric is suppose to be a fast pokemon. It's best stats are speed 
and sp. attack, but I just don't understand how a mega evolution can still 
be that fast, and still lug around that huge lightning bolt that's now a 
part of his back.
3. Gyarados. For over a decade, people have questioned why gyarados isn't a 
dragon type, and when they come up with a mega evolution, it's a 
water/dark? Wasteful. Also, gyarados' mega evolution actually got smaller 
than it's predecessor. Double wasteful. This was probably the most missed 
opportunity game freak had, as far as mega evolutions go.
2. Heracross. This doesn't pay homage to its predecessor at all. It's 
almost embarrassing. It makes me sad to look at it because it just doesn't 
look good at all. The same thing with gyarados, a missed opportunity on 
game freaks part.
1. Aerodactyl. The pointed stone on his chin is just terrible. In fact, the 
pointed stones everywhere are a terrible idea. You mean to tell me that 
Aerodactyl, one of the fastest pokemon in history, actually GAINS SPEED, 
even though their are large stones sticking out of it's wings. To me, that 
makes no sense. Just like with manetric's bolt. Fast pokemon need to have a 
fast look, and I don't believe that Aerodactyl can carry all those stones 
on its back and still maintain a fast speed.

Overall, I'd say that most of the mega evolutions aren't really anything 
great to look at. Out of all the mega evolutions, I would average them all 
around a five. However, some of them are extremely well designed and 
represent their predecessors very well, but for the first generation of 
megos, it's about average.﻿

I'm gonna give my opinions on what I think about them. 

Mega Venusaur: Ehh, it kinda looks the same to normal Venusaur. It's not 
that creative.                                          
Mega Gardevoir: It was a little bit better then Mega Venusaur's, but still 
a bit simple. I liked Lucario's Mega Evolution, that one was a bit less 
simple, and more creative.
Mega Aerodactyl: No, just no. It is a ROCK and flying type after all, but 
were the rocks REALLY necessary? They could've done a lot better on it. Not 
very impressed with this one.
Mega Manectric: I think they overdid it a bit. The Mega Evolutions should 
look a little bit like the normal Pokemon, but not too much, or not looking 
like it at all, which is kinda what they did with Mega Manectric.
Mega Mewtwo: Alright guys, Mega Mewtwo is actually REALLY powerful and all, 
but it's just the design in my opinion. I have a lot of problems with this 
one. In my opinion, it just doesn't look like Mewtwo at all. 

Okay guys, sorry if I wasted your time, if you read this all, then 
congratulations to you. XD

But Mega Garchomp actually saw Garchomp fall out of the Uber tier because 
of it's speed reduction and it not being able to stand up to the likes of 
Mega Altaria without Mega Evolving. We also see Dragonite, a pokemon from 
Gen I that lacks a Mega, still have the capability of sweeping Uber Teams 
(even those with the likes of the absolutely broken Mega Rayquaza) after 
setting up just one D-Dance. We also see Volcarona capable of doing the 
same thing with a Q-Dance. We also saw the rise of Flareon becoming viable 
for meta-game play with the addition of Flare Blitz to it's moveset and the 
re-introduction of iron tail, makin it a great Sylveon check. Arcanine is 
still one of the only Fire-type walling actions and while still heavily UU, 
it's a wild card capable of completely confounding OU and even Uber tier 
pokemon. Lugia is still decently overpowered, even for a pokemon in the

older ones, like Mewtwo and Darkrai. Your statement that newer pokemon will

out. While in the movies, and just overall, it looks like a guy, I don't 
think there is actually a set gender. I think that the two mega evolutions 
make it more feminine and more masculine, respective to their evolution.

similar to muscle or hair, like on males. It's shoulders become bigger and 
broader, while the Pokémon as a whole becomes bigger. The opposite, Mega 
Mewtwo Y is smaller, sleeker. The tail moves up to the head, in the fashion

headband. X is a fighting type, while Y looks more physic. Men are 
stereotyped as the big STRONG man with the SMART beautiful woman. These 
mega evolutions seem to separate genders. And if that isn't enough, X's 
eyes are blue, while Y's are pink. They are the two colors that make up 
purple, Mewtwo's original eye color. I think these evolutions are based to 
make Mewtwo gendered.﻿
